oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Khulāṣah-ʼi aḥvāl-i Bānū Bagum mukhāṭab ba-Mumtāz Maḥall : manuscript, undated
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Biography of Banū Begam, surnamed Mumtāz Maḥall, and known as Tāj Bībī, wife of Shāh Jahān, and of the buildings connected with her name.
On f. 1v, right after the title : "عرف تاج بي بي نبت نواب اصف خان ولد نواب اعتماد والدوله اسله خديون جماشان بهمابا وشاه غازي بن جنكيز شاه طاب شراه وجعل الجنت."
Written in one column, 7 lines per page, in black ink.
Ownership statement signed C.E. Norton and dated 1850 on rear paper wrapper 4.
MS Persian 90. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mumtaz Mahal--Empress, consort of Shahjahan, Emperor of India---1631
Shahjahan--Emperor of India--approximately 1592-1666
